algorithm_technique: Iterate through string, mark bold ranges using a lookup array, then merge overlapping/consecutive ranges.
Use a Trie to efficiently find all occurrences of words in the string.
problem_summary_simple: Wrap substrings found in a dictionary with bold tags, merging overlapping or adjacent tags.
problem_summary_technical: Identifies bolded segments using a lookup array (or Trie) and then merges overlapping/adjacent segments into single bold tags.
time_complexity: O(n * d * l) for naive find, O(n * l) with Trie, where n is s.length, d is dict.length, l is average word length.
space_complexity: O(n) for lookup array, O(t) for Trie, where t is Trie size.
key_insights: The core challenge is merging overlapping and adjacent bolded intervals.
A lookup array or a Trie can efficiently mark all characters that should be bolded.
Post-processing the marked characters to form the final bold tags is crucial.
